and shoot I'm shot in the upper left

exactly when I first came up with the

never went to Vietnam lots of guys
around me were gone I became a marksman
we all became marksmen but guns didn't I
didn't relate to guns and I didn't
relate to shooting and it was something
that I had to do going through that
process and then I got out of the army
and used my GI Bill to go back to school
and went to Irvine a bunch of us started

industrial space it was just a couple
doors down for my studio all of us I
think initially were doing painting and
making sculpture and playing with the

what he was doing where he was coming

going to get anywhere Chris came to me
and said he's thinking of doing a a

doing the best job I could the bullet
would whiz by my arm and it would
scratch it and one drop of blood would
roll down my fore
that was the ideal ideal yeah he stood
about 15 feet away from me you know he

he'd have some shooting he got shot you

it turned out to be flesh wound he went

just like hitting a corner of a

just got nicked by a giant force you

to death
and you know I don't think they believe

I enjoyed the peace and I appreciated
